titleStmt.title: James McGarth and William Herbert v King County. Original Testimony

bibl.title: James McGarth and William Herbert v. King County. Original Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: James Ludlow J.H. McGraw James Eatton F.W. Wald F.W. Brerrian J.L. Mixem E.L. Evershaw Robert Manger J. Beer

div1.p: J.H. McGraw am police officer of Seattle I arrested James McGarth left assisted by Count Mills. I helped search him and found 15 counterfit dollars of the United States upon his person. Had known deff Will Herbert 2 or 3 years, he claims to have been in company with James McGarth and to have aforementioned counterfit coin and he was therefore arrested.
James Eatton I am bartender on committment in Seattle. On March 14th deff James McGarth passed a counterfit dollar on me. (dollar shown) I know nothing of the other defendent
F.W. Wald I know deff William Herbert he found a counterfit dollar coin on this 17th of March. This is the dollar (dollar shown) attain count his arrest
LP Brerrian Keep Saloon pent street know deff Will Herbert by sight. He passed a counterfit coin dollar on me on March 16th 1880. I know nothing of the other defendent.
EL Evershan have seen deff Herbert cant say he was the man who passed in a counterfit coin.
Robert Magner I know deff Herbert he passed a counterfit coin dollar on me March 1st. My employee V. Schmidt has the dollar in his posession.
J Beer The deff Herbert came in my saloon on March 16th and offered one a dollar I told him it was counterfit and gave it back to him.
div1.ab: 2411. United States v. Charles McGarth + William Herbert Evidence Filed March 22nd 1880 James Seavey Clerk By James P. Ludlow Deputy Clerk
